title: Elven arrow
data:
**[English]()** • [中文（中国大陆）‎](/wiki/Elven_arrow/zh-CN "Elven arrow/zh-CN")

| ) [![Elven arrow.png](/images/4/4a/Elven_arrow.png)](/wiki/File:Elven_arrow.png) |                                                        |
| -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------ |
| Name                                                                             | elven arrow                                            |
| Appearance                                                                       | runed arrow                                            |
| Damage vs. small                                                                 | 1d7                                                    |
| Damage vs. large                                                                 | 1d6                                                    |
| To-hit bonus                                                                     | +0                                                     |
| Weapon skill                                                                     | [bow](/wiki/Bow "Bow")                                 |
| Size                                                                             | [one-handed](/wiki/One-handed "One-handed")            |
| Base price                                                                       | 2 [zm](/wiki/Zorkmid "Zorkmid") (+10/positive enchant) |
| Weight                                                                           | [1](/wiki/Weight "Weight")                             |
| Material                                                                         | [wood](/wiki/Wood "Wood")                              |

An **elven arrow** is a type of [projectile](/wiki/Projectile "Projectile") that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*. It is made of [wood](/wiki/Wood "Wood"), and appears as a **runed arrow** when [unidentified](/wiki/Identification "Identification").

Elven arrows are made for use with a [bow](/wiki/Bow "Bow"), and gain +1 [multishot](/wiki/Multishot "Multishot") and a +1 damage bonus when fired by an [elf](/wiki/Elf_\(monster_attribute\) "Elf (monster attribute)") (including an [elven](/wiki/Elf_\(starting_race\) "Elf (starting race)") character) from an [elven bow](/wiki/Elven_bow "Elven bow").[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)[\[2\]](#cite_note-2)

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)

- [2 Strategy](#Strategy)

- [3 History](#History)

- [4 Variants](#Variants)

  - [4.1 SLASH'EM](#SLASH.27EM)
  - [4.2 UnNetHack](#UnNetHack)
  - [4.3 dNetHack](#dNetHack)
  - [4.4 EvilHack](#EvilHack)
  - [4.5 Hack'EM](#Hack.27EM)

- [5 References](#References)

## Generation

Elven [Rangers](/wiki/Ranger "Ranger") start each game with +0 and +2 stacks of elven arrows in place of the role's standard [arrows](/wiki/Arrow "Arrow").[\[3\]](#cite_note-3)

General [stores](/wiki/Store "Store"), used armor dealerships and antique weapon outlets can sell elven arrows.

1⁄3 of live [elven](/wiki/Elf_\(monster_attribute\) "Elf (monster attribute)") monsters are [generated with](/wiki/Monster_starting_inventory "Monster starting inventory") an elven bow and 3–14 elven arrows.[\[4\]](#cite_note-4)

## Strategy

Elven arrows are marginally stronger than standard arrows, and are generally the most preferable type to use with a bow for characters not aiming to maximize multishot bonuses. One of their primary advantages is immunity to [erosion](/wiki/Erosion "Erosion") from rusting effects, which are generally more common than burning and rotting - in return, a character should switch to another set of projectiles when dealing with monsters with fiery [passive attacks](/wiki/Passive_attack "Passive attack") such as [fire elementals](/wiki/Fire_elemental "Fire elemental"), as well as monsters like [gelatinous cubes](/wiki/Gelatinous_cube "Gelatinous cube") that can engulf and eat them.

## History

The elven arrow is introduced in [NetHack 3.0.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.0.0 "NetHack 3.0.0").

## Variants

### SLASH'EM

In [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"), [upgrading](/wiki/Upgrading "Upgrading") elven arrows will produce standard arrows, and upgrading standard arrows has a 1⁄3 chance of producing elven arrows.

Shooting non-cursed elven arrows from any bow has a 1⁄3 chance of an additional +1 multishot bonus.[\[5\]](#cite_note-5)

### UnNetHack

In [UnNetHack](/wiki/UnNetHack "UnNetHack"), the second alternate layout of the [Castle](/wiki/Castle_\(UnNetHack\) "Castle (UnNetHack)") has a chance of generating blessed and enchanted elven arrows in the [barracks](/wiki/Barracks "Barracks") overlooking the [drawbridge](/wiki/Drawbridge "Drawbridge").

### dNetHack

In [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack") and [notdNetHack](/wiki/NotdNetHack "NotdNetHack"), elven arrows deal 1d7 damage to small monsters and 1d5 damage to large monsters, with a +2 [to-hit](/wiki/To-hit "To-hit") bonus.

### EvilHack

In [EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack"), elven Rangers that [invoke](/wiki/Invoke "Invoke") [The Longbow of Diana](/wiki/The_Longbow_of_Diana "The Longbow of Diana") will generate elven arrows instead of standard ones.

Elven arrows can be used at a [forge](/wiki/Forge_\(dungeon_feature\) "Forge (dungeon feature)") to create a couple of items:

- 2 elven arrows can be combined with a [knife](/wiki/Knife "Knife") to create an [elven dagger](/wiki/Elven_dagger "Elven dagger").
- 2 elven arrows can be combined with an elven dagger to create an [elven spear](/wiki/Elven_spear "Elven spear").

### Hack'EM

In [Hack'EM](/wiki/Hack%27EM "Hack'EM"), upgrading standard arrows will produce elven arrows, and upgrading elven arrows will produce [orcish arrows](/wiki/Orcish_arrow "Orcish arrow").

In addition to EvilHack forge recipes, 2 [darts](/wiki/Dart "Dart") can be combined with 2 elven arrows to create a knife.

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [src/dothrow.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 167](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/dothrow.c#L167): *multishot bonus*
2. [↑](#cite_ref-2) [src/uhitm.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 848](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/uhitm.c#L848): *damage bonus*
3. [↑](#cite_ref-3) [src/u\_init.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 208](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/u_init.c#L208)
4. [↑](#cite_ref-4) [src/makemon.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 222](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/makemon.c#L222)
5. [↑](#cite_ref-5) [dothrow.c in SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2, line 175](/wiki/Source:SLASH%27EM_0.0.7E7F2/dothrow.c#line175 "Source:SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2/dothrow.c")

Elven arrow

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
English

 • 中文（中国大陆）‎
)
Name elven arrow
Appearance runed arrow
Damage vs. small 1d7
Damage vs. large 1d6
To-hit bonus +0
Weapon skill bow
Size one-handed
Base price 2 zm
(+10/positive
enchant)
Weight 1
Material wood

An elven arrow is a type of projectile that appears in NetHack. It is made of wood, and appears as a runed arrow when unidentified.

Elven arrows are made for use with a bow, and gain +1 multishot and a +1 damage bonus when fired by an elf (including an elven character) from an elven bow.[1][2]

Contents

  • 1 Generation
  • 2 Strategy
  • 3 History
  • 4 Variants
    • 4.1 SLASH'EM
    • 4.2 UnNetHack
    • 4.3 dNetHack
    • 4.4 EvilHack
    • 4.5 Hack'EM
  • 5 References

Generation

Elven Rangers start each game with +0 and +2 stacks of elven arrows in place of the role's standard arrows.[3]

General stores, used armor dealerships and antique weapon outlets can sell elven arrows.

1⁄3 of live elven monsters are generated with an elven bow and 3–14 elven arrows.[4]

Strategy

Elven arrows are marginally stronger than standard arrows, and are generally the most preferable type to use with a bow for characters not aiming to maximize multishot bonuses. One of their primary advantages is immunity to erosion from rusting effects, which are generally more common than burning and rotting - in return, a character should switch to another set of projectiles when dealing with monsters with fiery passive attacks such as fire elementals, as well as monsters like gelatinous cubes that can engulf and eat them.

History

The elven arrow is introduced in NetHack 3.0.0.

Variants

SLASH'EM

In SLASH'EM, upgrading elven arrows will produce standard arrows, and upgrading standard arrows has a 1⁄3 chance of producing elven arrows.

Shooting non-cursed elven arrows from any bow has a 1⁄3 chance of an additional +1 multishot bonus.[5]

UnNetHack

In UnNetHack, the second alternate layout of the Castle has a chance of generating blessed and enchanted elven arrows in the barracks overlooking the drawbridge.

dNetHack

In dNetHack and notdNetHack, elven arrows deal 1d7 damage to small monsters and 1d5 damage to large monsters, with a +2 to-hit bonus.

EvilHack

In EvilHack, elven Rangers that invoke The Longbow of Diana will generate elven arrows instead of standard ones.

Elven arrows can be used at a forge to create a couple of items:

  • 2 elven arrows can be combined with a knife to create an elven dagger.
  • 2 elven arrows can be combined with an elven dagger to create an elven spear.

Hack'EM

In Hack'EM, upgrading standard arrows will produce elven arrows, and upgrading elven arrows will produce orcish arrows.

In addition to EvilHack forge recipes, 2 darts can be combined with 2 elven arrows to create a knife.

References

  1. ↑ src/dothrow.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 167: multishot bonus
  2. ↑ src/uhitm.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 848: damage bonus
  3. ↑ src/u_init.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 208
  4. ↑ src/makemon.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 222
  5. ↑ dothrow.c in SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2, line 175

An '''elven arrow''' is a type of [[projectile]] that appears in ''[[NetHack]]''. It is made of [[wood]], and appears as a '''runed arrow''' when [[Identification|unidentified]].

Elven arrows are made for use with a [[bow]], and gain +1 [[multishot]] and a +1 damage bonus when fired by an [[Elf (monster attribute)|elf]] (including an [[Elf (starting race)|elven]] character) from an [[elven bow]].{{refsrc|src/dothrow.c|167|nethack=3.6.7|comment=multishot bonus}}{{refsrc|src/uhitm.c|848|nethack=3.6.7|comment=damage bonus}}

==Generation==
Elven [[Ranger]]s start each game with +0 and +2 stacks of elven arrows in place of the role's standard [[arrow]]s.{{refsrc|src/u_init.c|208|nethack=3.6.7}}

General [[store]]s, used armor dealerships and antique weapon outlets can sell elven arrows.

{{frac|3}} of live [[Elf (monster attribute)|elven]] monsters are [[monster starting inventory|generated with]] an elven bow and {{rn1|12|3}} elven arrows.{{refsrc|src/makemon.c|222|nethack=3.6.7}}

==Strategy==
Elven arrows are marginally stronger than standard arrows, and are generally the most preferable type to use with a bow for characters not aiming to maximize multishot bonuses. One of their primary advantages is immunity to [[erosion]] from rusting effects, which are generally more common than burning and rotting - in return, a character should switch to another set of projectiles when dealing with monsters with fiery [[passive attack]]s such as [[fire elemental]]s, as well as monsters like [[gelatinous cube]]s that can engulf and eat them.

==History==
The elven arrow is introduced in [[NetHack 3.0.0]].

==Variants==
===SLASH'EM===
In [[SLASH'EM]], [[upgrading]] elven arrows will produce standard arrows, and upgrading standard arrows has a {{frac|3}} chance of producing elven arrows.

Shooting non-cursed elven arrows from any bow has a {{frac|3}} chance of an additional +1 multishot bonus.{{refsrc|dothrow.c|175|version=SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2}}

===UnNetHack===
In [[UnNetHack]], the second alternate layout of the [[Castle (UnNetHack)|Castle]] has a chance of generating blessed and enchanted elven arrows in the [[barracks]] overlooking the [[drawbridge]].

===dNetHack===
In [[dNetHack]] and [[notdNetHack]], elven arrows deal 1d7 damage to small monsters and 1d5 damage to large monsters, with a +2 [[to-hit]] bonus.

===EvilHack===
In [[EvilHack]], elven Rangers that [[invoke]] [[The Longbow of Diana]] will generate elven arrows instead of standard ones.

Elven arrows can be used at a [[Forge (dungeon feature)|forge]] to create a couple of items:

* 2 elven arrows can be combined with a [[knife]] to create an [[elven dagger]].
* 2 elven arrows can be combined with an elven dagger to create an [[elven spear]].

===Hack'EM===
In [[Hack'EM]], upgrading standard arrows will produce elven arrows, and upgrading elven arrows will produce [[orcish arrow]]s.

In addition to EvilHack forge recipes, 2 [[dart]]s can be combined with 2 elven arrows to create a knife.
